website_summaries.verdict: With a sharp display and hands-free Alexa integration, Amazon's 10-inch Fire HD 10 tablet is the best value for your dollar under $150.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: So glad we defected from Apple to these! We wanted to replace our iPads as they were out of scope for iOS updates, but obviously anything Apple is so expensive. We got two of these Fire tablets for a fraction of a full price cheapest Apple tablet. If your whole life is intrinsically linked together in every way via Apple then you probably won’t like these, but we like them for that very opposite reason! Very user friendly and very pleased with them and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just as I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: I was perfectly happy with my HD 8 but fancied a larger screen. I've matched this one up with an old Perixx bluetooth keyboard (which just so happens to match the width) plus a cheap Syntaks cover and so far, I have used the set-up like a laptop with a touchscreen (see photo)- I can't seem to do without the physical keyboard (it's not brilliant using the on-screen one, particularly in landscape). The ONLY issue I have is the restrictive operating system, but there are well-documented ways around this, so no big deal, especially at the Black Friday price. No regrets so far and I've pretty much stopped using my Windows 10 laptop which is quite frankly a pain!
customer_reviews.author: P. Yates

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet bt 2 months and factory reset needed
customer_reviews.text: This is a good budget tablet, lighter and thinner than my work Ipad 9.7 and a really nice screen when it works. However yesterday at about 8 weeks old it decides to start rebooting every minute or two. Support suggested a factory reset (so bye bye data) which I eventually managed to make happen today when the reboots slackened off to every 5 min and so didn't cancel the reset. That seemed to cure it, well for a short time, it is now dead as doornail! Shut itself down while on about half charge refuses to turn back on either stand alone or plugged in. Not what I expect from a tablet less than 2 months old.
customer_reviews.author: D. K. Talbot

customer_reviews.title: Verrrrry Slowwww
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed with this device. It's just so slow, with pages taking forever to load. Even with a great internet connection, this tablet just seems to struggle. I unfortunately threw the packaging away, which means I'm unable to refund. I've given it 2 stars, as the sound and picture are great for films.
customer_reviews.author: Kieran

customer_reviews.title: Blatant sales and marketing tool that runs like a three-legged tortoise
customer_reviews.text: This is such a blatant sales and marketing tool for Amazon that they should be giving it away rather than selling it. Stuffed to the gills with Amazon-related apps (and those "Special Offers") that gobble up all the RAM and don't let it go. The result is that the device is painfully slow most of the time. Accessing and searching the Internet takes ages. You pretty much need to shut down and restart the device each time you pick it up to release enough RAM to be able to do anything with it. It does have a nice screen, but what's the point if the device runs like a three-legged tortoise? Frustrating, to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Above expectations.
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to use and a revelation for me. My first tablet, avoided them as did want to be overburdened by technology. What can I say...how foolish. This Fire is so easy to use I can see my laptop becoming redundant. The screen resolution and picture is amazing. The only downside is I can not get my Apple emails and being in family prime gets you video but not music. These two things are minor though.
customer_reviews.author: Tonka

customer_reviews.title: Its partner (same spec) failed and binned after 18mths
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, works great, great value compared to others....so you think. Bought my first early 2017, then a 2nd some months later. 1st failed this week. Amazon say its unfixable and offered 20% discount off a new one. £209.99 outlay swiped into bin in one short call after 18mths usage. Utter waste and complaining to Amazon is in short a life shortening experience as they don't read e-mails and cut n paste every possible angle into the e-mail, most of no consequence. Horrid experience all round. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Jonjo

customer_reviews.title: The worst tablet i had
customer_reviews.text: The worst tablet i had! First one i received i had to send back because it was switching itself off for no reason. Second one is dying when not use and it's very hard to turn it back on. Apps are not the best as well. The only reason why i'm keeping it's i'm on holidays and don't have an option to send it back. Avoid!
customer_reviews.author: Filip

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tablet because of good reviews. It is terrible user unfriendly. you have the adds all over the tablet. it makes it really a pain. like apple is a problem to get things that are from other sources other than Amazon. It is a terrible choice. you should buy something from Samsung because although their tablets are more expensive they are good and user friendly and can install any programme without problems.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Could have been a great product, sadly let down with very poor wifi ...
customer_reviews.text: Could have been a great product, sadly let down with very poor wifi connectivity which is widely reported about on the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Delboymel

customer_reviews.title: Very poor internet connection
customer_reviews.text: Not great quality drops internet connection very easly every couple of minutes if you reboot it you'll get a week before internet connection starts dropping again and you have to reboot again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A lot of device for the money
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my mother who's 80 and not keen on technology but once we had set it up for her she finds it easy to use. It a weird shape very tall but if you wanted to watch movies on then it would be good. I purchased this one preloved and saved myself some money and got a product which looked brand new to me. The app store is limited and you really need to have a prime account to get the most of it. Now to teach my mother to say Alexa as she keeps saying Elexa
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Lipski

customer_reviews.title: Not fit for purpose!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is not fit for purpose. Ive never been able to print from it although it recognises my printer and although Amazon UK was asked for advice none was ever forthcoming. It is barely 6 weeks old and it now has continuous problems connecting to the internet while all other devices can connect. I thought this would be a basic tablet given the price however It now has no functionality and therefore worthless. Best to pay more and get something that functions!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Irene B

customer_reviews.title: jindle fire 10.1
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old Kindle fire with the new 10.1 and well worth it. Really fast a selection of voices for voice to text so I have started buying books again. Alexa is fantastic the only one in my house that listens to me does what I ask and switches my lights on and off. The speed is very fast. The camera a bit difficult but still learning to zoom etc. The battery also seems good. I would reccomend. The fact I cannot cast or mirror the screen to my TV is a problem. so cannot give it 5. If anyone can help with the mirror to tv I would give it 5
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Overall disappointed, however, good for watching online TV/Films
customer_reviews.text: The tablet is good value and ideal for surfing the web or watching some streamed source. However, I’m disappointed that the Amazon App Store is limited and does not contain some of the Apps I wanted (BT Sport, Firefox, Internet banking Etc.) and there are adverts on the screen saver which cost £10 to remove. In fairness to Amazon, I am sure they made me aware of the adverts, however, I missed this and did not expect this so disappointed. Amazon would do well to allow moving of these adverts for nothing to give the experience of a professional tablet and not making it feel like a trial version.
customer_reviews.author: M R Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Seemed at first an excellent product that has fulfilled my expectations, but very disappointing subseq
customer_reviews.text: Seemed really useful and very good quality, also backed up by a 24\7 call back phone line. All the products purchased for my previous downloaded into my new kindle with the exception of my music. A member of Amazon staff solved the problem with great patience and obviously considerable knowledge. Very clear screen. But turned out to have very poor internet reception and touch keyboard that becomes unresponsive at the sides regularly.
customer_reviews.author: G. B. A. Mcginn

customer_reviews.title: Kindle does it again
customer_reviews.text: I had my previous fire kindle for 5 years & I was extremely satisfied with its performance. I only bought this as I somehow managed to kill that device & was missing using it. So far, so good. I haven't had to plug in my computer as this does everything that I need. I've been using it for around 4/5 hours each day and have had no problems so far! The larger screen size makes it easier to watch than the previous 7 inch screen. Hurrah for kindle!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Nugent

customer_reviews.title: Useless, don't buy one.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a loyal Amazon customer. I bought this as a brand new (not refurbished) item. The on/off button worked once, it worked to turn it on, then hasn't worked since. I'm no Apple fan but you can expect the build quality of annipad to be much better than this. THEN to add insult to injury, I'm expected to return the item at my own expense and I'm liable for it until received by Amazon. A really unhappy, loyal customer.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Superb value
customer_reviews.text: I've seen some of the adverse comments about lack of Google Playstore but if you need those apps it's not very difficult to download them. I used Aptoide to download additional apps. If the install button doesn't respond press the start button to send it to sleep press again, swipe upwards to return to install screen and the button should work. If you're a prime member this is a great tablet to have and whilst picture quality maybe a tad less than an Ipad it's nearly a third cheaper and you are not locked into Apple. It's a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Up North

customer_reviews.title: Light enough to hold & have on my lap
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that was like my Laptop in it's set-up but was lighter in weight. Although it IS lighter I feel like a beginner in computers in the way it is set up. It's taking me ages to suss things out. Nothing seems straightforward & I find there are too many options & I haven't a clue which one I'm supposed to go for. I spend hours looking & getting no-where it then becomes frustrating. Photo's & similar are brilliantly clear. As so many people have given good ratings it may be my lack of knowledge so I will persevere & hope that one day I'll understand it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Owen

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working unable to charge, still under warranty but trying to return through Amazon is difficult.
customer_reviews.author: lorraine christian

customer_reviews.title: Good but adding Play Store is essential
customer_reviews.text: Apps are limited with the Amazon OS - android minus but it's a no brainer IF you install play store (I replaced an aging iPad with this). Google's "install play store on Amazon fire" to find how do this - you need to install 4 apk files & and it took a little while for me to get this right. My main disappointment is the poor sound especially if you buy the dock or an Amazon cover - both have plastic surrounds & limit the speaker sound so much that the have to remove them for listening. Major plus is price and Alexa compatabilty although if I would go for a Samsung if you want better sound over this.
customer_reviews.author: BAReading

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for ease of use and for carrying around.
customer_reviews.text: Albeit I bought this on Black Friday at an excellent discount, I would highly recommend the Fire HD 10 Tablet anytime. Once you get used to it, you will find it difficult to put down. It is so fast (obviously as you have nothing much to fill the memory up with, not like on a laptop or computer), and very handy to carry around. I find compared to an i-Pad, it is a lot easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst tablet we have ever purchased. Christmas present for daughter which I though had set up prior to Christmas Day, but suddenly Alexes decided that it was not going to work. Had to reset it to factory settings but the damage was done and gift rejected. Signed in to tablet but it didn’t recognise we already had Prime etc with no option to save same details. Shocking waste and will be looking for money back and go back to Samsung or Apple. You get what you pay for I assume.
customer_reviews.author: mr martin j hughes

customer_reviews.title: Not really a fan....
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a replacement for my google nexus tablet and thought this might be just the ticket as I can’t really justify the money for a ipad. My primary uses are browsing / YouTube / movies and I do use a chromecast from time to time. The fire tablet is quick to launch, with pretty reasonable battery life and a half decent screen... but I really disliked the OS and couldn’t install the things I really wanted. No way of installing a browser I prefer, really shoddy version of the YouTube app that doesn’t cut the mustard. I returned mine after 48 hours as I just couldn’t get along with it.
customer_reviews.author: P A Horwell

customer_reviews.title: This Fire 10 tablet is Rubbish
customer_reviews.text: It is only useful for Amazon to advertise their products and services. the voice search engine can only answer the most simple basic questions, and even then often gets it wrong. I would suggest you buy a proper tablet, there are plenty advertised on the Fire 10 - Its good at adverts!. I gave it one star as its easy to switch on. I would like to send it back but it was bought before Christmas as a present only to be opened on the day.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B. Carney

customer_reviews.title: Not intuitive, actually a real pain
customer_reviews.text: Turn the tablet on an the screen goes black. Have to keep pressing the on button but screen keeps going black. Bought to be an ultimate Amazon device but with prime video, had to go into my Amazon shopping account to change the settings so I could actually watch programmes. It would be easier to access to Prime via an Android device. Because of the former issue will return and replace for something like hat works.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet, Shame it’s flimsy and unfixable once warranty up - reconsider if for a child
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my now 11yr old the warranty was just up Christmas it’s the 4th tablet I’ve bought from amazon. It cracked at the screen at the weekend I enquired locally about getting it fixed was told these are unfixable as cheaper to buy new, having confirmed with customer service there now confirmed buy new or tough luck - DO NOT BUY unless willing to buy new again when something happens to it - customer service also stated amazon do not fix tablets, and this is not a kids tablet?? So once out of warranty you’ll have to dump it if anything happens - it’s a shame amazon manufacture such flimsy unfixable goods hence the 1star
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Toye

customer_reviews.title: Faulty kindle  supposed to be new
customer_reviews.text: This kindle fire 10 with alex a 32 GB keeps freezing. I contacted the seller a day after return was eligible i was told resetting to the factory setup would cure the problem. It hasn't. Now contacting seller is No longer available. I bought this 2/10/2018. I wondered why protect insurance wasn't available for this kindle yet i was able to insure my kindle fire 10 with alex a 64GB.
customer_reviews.author: mona

customer_reviews.title: Crash city.. Avoid.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. The os is clunky and almost every app I run crashes constantly. It's a frustrating mess. Cheap, but you are better off buying something else. For example I initially used it to run my sonos speaker. But it crashes before finishing a song. Though now it also won't update the os, even though it's only a few months old and now sonos won't run at all. All other apps have regular crashes, I can't remember it running an app without crashing.. Nice screen.. That's about the best I can say. Avoid it. Its not even worth one star but I couldn't give it less.
customer_reviews.author: digi-mech

customer_reviews.title: Please sort out kindle fire
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in my fire. It was purchased on 28th September and is now almost useless. It keeps turning itself off and then won't turn on for hours. This is my third kindle fire the last one only lasted a year before it played up. I felt on my kindle to keep in contact with family and friends when unwell as I can have long stays in hospital with my chronic chest conditions. Amazon please sort this situation out for me
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Device, Fast, Stylish and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: What more could you ask for from a device, it's really fast, weight is ok, screen is brilliant. Sound is fantastic, Wi-Fi is superb and it is very stylish, Only one issue is the operating system while Amazon have made it fantastic it is lacking what other Android devices can give for the similar price.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Parker

customer_reviews.title: Buy Cheap, Buy Twice
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for - these tables are cheaply made junk. Bought November 2017 for my daughter. It has had very light use as we strictly restrict her usage. It's now unusable slow, and I literally just watched the battery indicator count down from 30% to zero at a rate of 1% a second, then simply shut down. I have reset to factory defaults a few times & wiped all content and still no good. I have an iPad 2 from donkeys years ago still going strong! It's awful to know that this will simply end up in land fill after less than 18 months, shame on you Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: matty

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my kindle fire hd 7 that had finally given up. I was not disappointed! Great easy to use layout even for a technophobe like me. Very little set up needed straight out the box. Picture and sound quality superb for a tablet and very fast. Highly recommended. A side note though a few games that I had on my old one I can't get on this for some reason but it has more than redeemed itself with other features including Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with bluetooth headphones
customer_reviews.text: I like it for Kindle, Netflix and internet. Not very happy that it doesn't connect to wireless headphones via bluetooth which is going backwards in my opinion🔌🔌🎧🎧🎧 I have to revert to my old Kindle Fire to listen to Audible while working around the house which defeats the purpose of buying a new one. Thought it would be great to have everything on one device but now I've to switch between two. Very disappointed with this 😕😕📻📻🎧🎧🔌🔌👎👎
customer_reviews.author: Nicola

customer_reviews.title: A terrible device!
customer_reviews.text: A terrible device. Brought on that back of 2 children Fire Tablets which are fantastic. Unfortunately I cannot say anything positive about this device. Lack of apps in the store, the home screen set up with all the adverts, and finally when it decides to do an update it removes all profiles to then have to re-sign in on them all. Having had android tablets and iPads I have decided this is cheap for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: Clare Archer

customer_reviews.title: my 6th kindle
customer_reviews.text: I am fed up with having to charge my new kindle. takes ages to charge but does not hold the charge for long. Also I'm fed up with having to buy new kindles because the charging ports go faulty just as the warranty expires. HENCE MY SIXTH KINDLE. i REALLY AM VERY DISSATISFIED CUSTOMER!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Jill

customer_reviews.title: why tie yourself to Amazon and a second rate android experience?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a present for someone but as they can't use most Google Play apps this is largely a waste of time and money. If it was mine I could root it or side-load apps to get over Amazons petty and, frankly greedy, restrictions but as it was a present and I don't know what will happen if they update the os I'm reluctant to. In summary, what is the point of restricting yourself to a second rate tablet experience for no appreciable benefit?? Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pullin

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you know why you’re buying this device.
customer_reviews.text: My wife won this device while gaming on line but neither of us can work out what to do with it. When you turn it on you have to sign in using your Amazon account details or it won’t do anything. However, once you’re in you can watch endless amounts of adverts and buy lots of recommended stuff from Amazon. If you haven’t guessed already it’s like a glorified Amazon basket. Don’t get me wrong, I buy all my stuff from Amazon and I love them to bits BUT, as far as this device is concerned, I’d rather have the money if you don’t mind.
customer_reviews.author: Just a dude

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Only buy this if you only intend using a few (mostly rubbish) apps. Any good app you hear about and want to use you will most likely find is NOT available for the restrictive Fire-OS. I really recommend anybody thinking of buying this check to see if their favourite apps are available first. The specs/quality hardly seem important for a practically unusable device. In addition, calling adverts on the lock screen "Special Offers" is very misleading. It implies you are getting something extra of a positive nature, which really is not the case. A very poor show indeed !
customer_reviews.author: Lee Long

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this item. Due to having a severe macular problem with my eyes and being unable to see a standard television clearly, I wanted a product which would allow me to watch tv programmes whilst holding the gadget in front of my face. It is great for BBC programmes but I am unable to watch other channels because I am unable to download Adobe flash player. This fact was never brought to my attention when purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: J Millington

customer_reviews.title: Huge Problems charging
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased one of these in 2016 and it lasted 18 months before it developed a problem charging. Thinking maybe I got unlucky, and being happy with it otherwise, I purchased another one in October 2018. This one lasted until February 2019 before developing the same problem. As this one was under warranty Amazon replaced it without a quibble, clearly because this is a very common fault. I say this because the replacement one has also developed the fault (May 2019) and I am currently awaiting it's replacement. Needless to say that when the warranty runs out I will NOT be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: sezg

customer_reviews.title: Starts off great, quickly becomes apparent why it's cheaper than it's competitor's. Really wanted to love the fire but......
customer_reviews.text: Revised review I've had the kindle fire for 7 months. At first I was really impressed. Good solid tablet, value for money and a suitable replacement for the iPad. Now I know why it's cheap - WiFi, I can be sat next to my router and the tablet constantly drops the connection. Apps hang and fail to load. Silk - oh my god, constant 'connection interuption', constant 'site timeout'. Don't have this problem with my 5 year old iPad whose ios is out of date and is no longer supported
customer_reviews.author: David Clarke

customer_reviews.title: In the UK? Don't Bother
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 64GB with the show dock and case, all the trimmings. It got delivered right at the very end of the next day - thanks Prime. I opened it and it said Show Mode not available in your region. I chatted to four different Indian support staff, none of whom could help me. The last one made me download in Windows an update that then couldn't be copied to the Fire. Totally useless. I wanted this as an extension to my Alexa with the functionality of a tablet. Never again Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: HP Camper

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly Bad, might as well have mugged me in the street.
customer_reviews.text: Un-Fixed Design Flaw. Loose Charging socket eventually deems device as USELESS. Charging becomes very difficult, as you have to wiggle the end of the lead for it to charge. Eventually it fails completely. I did complain after 10 1/2 months and had a replacement which was easy to do. That was the one and only positive. However, after only 8 weeks same has happened again & I'm out of warranty. Looked here on reviews & others are having same issue. So £149 down the drain. Thx Amazon. Feel like I've been mugged in the street.
customer_reviews.author: Seamaster

customer_reviews.title: As a tablet fine, BEWARE the charging port is very poor.
customer_reviews.text: Having had this tablet for 18 months the overall experience has been good. However the charging port has now started acting up which is a common problem looking at the rest of the reviews. Amazons answer is to just offer a 15% discount on a new one and send the defective one to landfill. Its a shame that a global company like Amazon does not have any facility for out of warranty repair. Just want to sell another box. A shame really as there is nothing wrong with the rest of it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Parker

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: My previous tablet gave out on me and I was researching a replacement when I came across the Amazon Fire. I wanted a 10" screen = ✔ Must be fast = ✔ easy to use = ✔ reasonably priced = ✔ stylish = ✔ in fact I just stopped looking after i found this one. It sounded like it had everything I wanted. Delivery was fast and straight out of the fantastic packaging i was impressed. It's light, sets itself up and is really fast. I love it and wish I'd found the Fire sooner! It's every I'd hoped it would be.
customer_reviews.author: BDH

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Tablet Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I'm really surprised by the amazon fire tablet. I thought it would be rubbish but it has really taken me by surprise . the tablet is fast on all tasks wether it's browsing the net or watching movies. Even playing the demanding games its quick and the screen quality is amazing for the prize. Alexa is always on to help with doing tasks or as wearing your questions. The battery life has been really great with more then a full dy usage for my needs. Overall I would say if your looking for a tablet get this it won't let you down and the prize is amazing .
customer_reviews.author: Riza Thayanithy

customer_reviews.title: Six months after i purchased the kindle it does not ...
customer_reviews.text: Six months after i purchased the kindle it does not charge and remains flat, DO NOT BUY THIS DEVICE IF YOU WANT A RELIABLE TABLET!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gareth Swift

customer_reviews.title: Power display
customer_reviews.text: After 10 months use kindle displays a fairly charge reading sometimes on charge for some hours with only a couple of percentage extra charge then another time charges fully charging lead changed still erratic problem would not recommend this model kindle to anyone out kindle 7s working well for years.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: A very good tablet better with Play Store
customer_reviews.text: A very good tablet, you can install Google Play Store, get it from apkmirror and copy it to the device. That massively extend it's usability. It's also possible to put the useless countless icons into groups to clean up the screen.
customer_reviews.author: NR in London

customer_reviews.title: Great value tablet but still has a few issues
customer_reviews.text: Ordered due to the good level of parental controls that it allowed and the price is very good compared to other tablets of a similar spec. However, due to the rather poor and now old-fashioned Micro-USB connection the tablet stopped working as we couldn't charge it any more, the connection eventually wears out and just becomes very loose. Amazon need to change these devices to a USB-C connection before I would ever consider buying again. The tablet itself however is superb, has a great feature set and the spec's mean it works very well. The parental controls and passwords are all a bit confusing as it's hard to work out which password controls which access (And I'm a techie!!!).
customer_reviews.author: Phat Planet

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly fragile tablet . Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Got the device at Christmas and bought my brother and sister one . After 2 months I was like most people do lie on the sofa and I getting up it slipped off falling approx 18 inches to the carpet hitting a half shell of a pistachio nut . Upon picking it up the screen looked smashed but wasn't smashed externally. Thinking it was a viris for I tried resetting it thinking theirs no way it could be broke from that and it didn't turn on . Its broke and has never worked again. probably the most fragile divise on the market .
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Replace old fire tablet
customer_reviews.text: After trying a couple of 10 tablets i returned to the new fire 10. Better than the old one and beats others at the price and some dearer. it suits what I need it for web browsing on line shopping. I matched this with neo 10, no comparison, battery life matches most others, you get what you pay for it course, several things still to learn. All in all for my use it gets a 10/10, for my use it does what it says on the tin.
customer_reviews.author: iandiarthur

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this tablet, buy another reliable brand
customer_reviews.text: Bought 23rd November 2018 8 months later it stopped charging so got a replacement where I had to pay next day delivery to send back, didn't get money back. 6 months later the new one did exactly the same thing I would assume warranty goes from new tablet but it doesn't. This tablet obviously has issues with the charging points and now stuck with a tablet that is 6 months old and it doesn't work, Amazon have offered me 20% off a new tablet which I am not going to use as have no faith in their tablets at all now. I will be buying elsewhere. Def avoid this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: cathy

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware but buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: The unit has a good size of screen, great image quality, cheaply expandable memory. Easy to use. Good battery life. Problem is that Amazon are in a stupid competition with Google. This means that the tablet does not come with nor want to have Google Play installed on it. You have to disable the app security setting then install several akp files available from different websites to get GP on the Fire. Then not all GP apps will work as they have not been optimised for the Fire version of android. Check there are no apps in GP, not available through Amazon, you really want. This was an unpleasant surprise for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lacks cross compatibility.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure the fire tablets are ok for users who are using amazons own media packages exclusively, but I was very disappointed that the architecture in these tablets not supporting popular formats from windows, do not expect to be able to port MP4 files without first converting, (not easy or guaranteed to work). I would have liked to know this before I purchased. So to sum up the product quality is good, but if you have a back catalogue of video or music that you wish to be able to port then look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kajun

customer_reviews.title: Just found that it doesn't connect to a TV
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife primarily as a cheaper replacement for her old iPad. However, its just so limited and its wifi connection is dreadful (other devices in the house have no problem). Now we have just tried to get a cable to connect it to the TV to watch films etc on a larger screen but after a fruitless search, Amazon Tech now tell us it doesn't have this functionality - wish I'd known all these shortcomings earlier as I wouldn't have bought it even at the reduced price. Very disappointing product.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Good value tablet.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on price, as to replace my current Samsung tablet would cost far more than this. The device is nice size and weight and seems well built and the screen is good for viewing webpages and video. Set-up is easy too. Downside is that I am used to Google so miss some of the apps that I could get on play store, and some Amazon equivalent are not so good i.e the Maps. is nowhere near Google maps. The Mail app and calendar sync with Gmail so that's good. For this price I can live with some of the small inconveniences, as I have the other apps on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mac

customer_reviews.title: Battery stops charging 2 months after 1 year warranty runs out :(
customer_reviews.text: The tablet was sort of okay. The build quality is nowhere near as good as the 8.9" HDX i bought almost a decade ago from amazon. Infact, that tablet still works perfectly (except they scummily won't allow it to update to latest OS versions to try to get you to buy new things). Anyway, this tablet worked as a glorified mp3 player and sometimes-mini tv for about a year. Now it's dead weight.
customer_reviews.author: D.M.B

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: Firstly very competitive price , it seems. First couple of months a minor issue with automatically switching off.. however after that no serious issue.. working at the low price tablet level fine. 13 months post purchase and just one month after warranty expired the charging port suddenly gave up. Rang amazon told me unfortunately warranty has expired but we can give you 15percent discount for your next equally ''reliable'' fire tablet purchase... Ridiculous ... The fact that Amazon is defrauding it's clients by knowingly selling a detective product is speaks by itself...
customer_reviews.author: charalampidis sotirios

customer_reviews.title: Keep taking the tablets
customer_reviews.text: I was rather irritated by the amount of advertising that appeared and was no best pleased to have to pay to remove them. I also found to my horror that the tablet was merrily downloading movies and shows without my knowledge. Fortunately I discovered this accidentally and put a stop to it because had I been at work or out and about my data allowance would have been hammered. Bad show Amazon and simply not enough to simply say, "It's all in the fine print and you agreed to it". I'm going to have to look closer lest I have given Amazon permission to take one of my kidneys.
customer_reviews.author: JMD1

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy if you can afford for it to not charge after eleven month of Purchase!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My brother bought me a new Kindle Fire 10", which was very good of him,but within 11 months it now is not charging I have bought new cables in case the old one has stopped working but no that was, and is not the case. So I repeat if you can afford to buy and have it give up in less than a year then go ahead!!!! Now if anyone can tell me where Amazons complaint department is I would love to know..... because Amazon I have a complaint!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie A Telling

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! I’ve literally had the Fire for two days and it already won’t charge, apps keep crashing when open and the operation speed is very slow. Please avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin Steele

customer_reviews.title: Think carefully before buying
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this with the alexa show stand to use in my office. Turns out it doesn't work the same as an actual alexa show. You cant add it to speaker groups etc. I practically have to shout at it to get it to pick up my commands and if I'm playing Netflix or music she just doesnt hear me saying Alexa. Very dissapointing compared to an actual alexa show. Tablet is ok, not as good as an iPad but better than most android pads. Good for checking emails, web surfing and watching netflix, though really to get good sound you need to use headphones as the built in speaker is a little rubbish.
customer_reviews.author: Rjnewton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent e-reader, useful size for other purposes
customer_reviews.text: I listen to books via Text-to-Speech, and use the Kindle as a phone and as a sketchpad, as well as for social media.. I find it excellent value for money. There are some fairly considerable issues with TTS pronunciations, however. There's a disproportionate tendency to substitute US state names where wildly inappropriate: for example, 'Cal' is almost always a man's name, not the state of California, and 'Miss' is near universally always an unmarried female, not the state of Mississippi. Also, 'minute' is overwhelmingly the unit of time, not "my newt", the infinitessimal. That's just 3 in the book I'm currently listening to.
customer_reviews.author: Mistress Vanilla

customer_reviews.title: Nice looks, shame about the content.
customer_reviews.text: It's a really nice looking device which is badly let down by the lack of useful apps. My aging iPad has become virtually obsolete as it can no longer be upgraded to the latest firmware, so I thought I would try something a bit different. What a disappointment. The apps I want to use are either not available or simply don't work. A real letdown. If you only want to use social media, email and watch videos, then great. Everything else, forget it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my 7 yr old Fire 7 which was becoming slow, had a cracked screen and the battery required frequent charging. Having monitored prices for several weeks I had intended to buy a Fire HD8, but the prime day deal for the 10 was just to good to ignore. Screen display is very good, ability to have expanded memory card and more computing power fully justified this decision. Very easy to set up and most apps transfer automatically from my Fire 7. Slight downside, it is a bit heavier and the keyboard requies to hands as the screen is that much larger.
customer_reviews.author: D. EVEREST

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Have used my iPad mini daily for over 4 years and although it’s still great, the battery life was becoming terrible. So treated myself to a Kindle Fire 10 HD and so far I’m delighted with it - obviously a much improved battery seeing as it’s brand new - but a really speedy & responsive performance. I only tend to use tablets for streaming, so have installed Netflix, Prime Video, Sky Go & iPlayer and apart from shopping & reading I don’t suppose I’ll use it for much more but the picture/sound quality is great. For what I want it for, it’s absolutely ideal and at a really good price.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy.

customer_reviews.title: Star buy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this Amazon Fire Tablet to replace an old Samsung mainly for playing games and web surfing, we feel we've made a really good purchase in fact dare I say it's very similar in quality and usage to an Apple iPad so we are very happy. It was easy to set up and didn't spring any surprises except for Alexa, she's a bit weird at the moment but once I've asserted who's boss we'll probably rub along well together.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Stone

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet on market
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet that’s why I bought new for an upgrade. Quality product. Was a little worried at first as WiFi not working properly as my older one was getting brilliant signal all over the house. Decided to buy a booster & works perfectly in areas it didn’t before. Battery runs low quicker than advertised but I could be running something in the background that I don’t know about as yet. Excellent screen viewing for videos, TV, photos etc. Managed to migrate all my books onto this & the screen reading is brilliant, adjusting to light accordingly. Best ‘little’ tablet on the market will cure all your worries of others.
customer_reviews.author: foxy

customer_reviews.title: Super tablet...at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with this. Ordered after my iPad finally gave up, and I couldn’t afford a new one. I prefer it actually...never thought I’d be saying that! Great screen...really super colours and no glare. I use it mainly to read (kindle app), watch Netflix ‘on the go’ and browsing online. I’m not an ‘app geek’ so don’t need infinite apps and I don’t ‘game’ so can’t comment on that. It’s a good looking tablet...I thought it might feel plastic-y or cheap, but it doesn’t at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn F

customer_reviews.title: ... offers for just under a hundred pounds and so glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on Prime day offers for just under a hundred pounds and so glad I did, what a bargain, I had one of the original fire tablets, this is a totally different animal, faster, more responsive, and comes with so many added features, like Alexa voice commands, I can highly recommend this tablet, even at its original price, a fantastic piece of kit
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Physically beautiful, functionally flawed
customer_reviews.text: Feels well built, solid, the screen is beautiful. But it's oh-so-slow. Glacially slow. Even just trying to switch between 2 running applications takes 5 or 6 seconds. The user interface is terrible - the Amazon fork of Android is intrusive and unintuitive. The selection of available applications is limited (unless you're willing to jump through all the hoops to side load Google Play) Because it feels so nice, I'd love to be able to recommend it - but it's simply too flawed to contemplate.
customer_reviews.author: Yet Another Alias

customer_reviews.title: I love Amazon but not this toy
customer_reviews.text: I have been using an Android Tablet and I liked it very much. But that cheap tablet broke its on/off switch only after 6 months so I thought its better to get an Amazon tablet as it is very hardy. I find that video quality is poor, and colour and contrast adjustments also bad. Finding anything from my secondary storage is not easy and most of the time some of the documents are hiding forever. If you are buying only for Amazon and Netflix it may be OK but this will not satisfy your requirements for all your tablet needs.
customer_reviews.author: Bright Lanka

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: Only had this for a few weeks now but I absolutely love it. Great for watching movies on the go and browsing the web. The picture quality is superb. I find it a bit big to hold when reading my books but can't really complain. Definitely would recommend this and have so already that they brought one themselves. It's at a fraction of the cost to other branded named but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs V

customer_reviews.title: Godd quality, very clear and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I liked this tablet very much, the quality of the screen was very good. The extra of Alexa was also a bonus. The only thig I have dropped a star off is because it can't completely replace my old tablet with it as it doesn't have play store. I'm pleased that I can still get Sky Go, but not Sky plus. Also, there are other apps I can't get due to not having play store. I will say that for the price, it is still excellent and I would recommend it as an extra tablet, especially to take away on holiday.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: its ok
customer_reviews.text: largely ok as a tablet. It is let down by two things. 1. It wont cast using Mira or Chromecast. 2. google play is not installed. I understand it can display on a fire stick - though if you have one I don't see why you would want to cast. The good bits - its quick enough, has plenty of storage and enough memory - just. It will need more as time goes on but that's not a problem at this time. The on - off case is a neat feature and I don't find anywhere else. As always it is good for amazon and it links with your amazon account as opposed to google on most androids.
customer_reviews.author: A. L. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great for magazines on Kindle
customer_reviews.text: Have been replacing subscriptions to paper magazines with Kindle subs as they fall due, and decided to get a bigger colour Kindle to view them more comfortably. Fantastic value for a good quality 10-inch pad at the recent special offer price, and has fully lived up to expectations for viewing magazines. Easy to set up, as all Kindles. Still find the smaller colour Kindle preferable for books with some pictorial content and the e-paper Kindle for books that are mostly text. Have not tried the Alexa or Show features.
customer_reviews.author: Purchaser, Suffolk UK

customer_reviews.title: Fire HD 10  Tablet 1080p  - excellent
customer_reviews.text: Arrived next day after ordering, came in its own box, cased in 2nd box, so arrived safely and now damage, very easy to set up, screen very clear, sound very good to, had to verify password when going on web sites I use, but again very easy, no problems, the tablet is very light weight , which makes it easy for me, I have arthritis, typing just needs the lightest of touch, overall it's a great fire tablet, great price to, I can now file away emails I want to keep, which I couldn't do on my smaller tablet, very easy to carry around, I would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone,
customer_reviews.author: Carla 33

customer_reviews.title: I use it for colour grading and networking
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit a 10" screen with a quad core CPU and 2gb of ram at this price is a bargain. I did have to put Google play on it but its primary use is so I can colour grade video with Tangent VS. using Chrome desktop I can remote into my computer's when out the house. And access my Plex server on the go. Using open VPN I can make it part of my network outside and pretty much do my on call tasks from it. It's well worth the money and the battery life is great. Highly recommend bit of kit for anyone to own.
customer_reviews.author: Riddle Box

customer_reviews.title: Sad to say i CAnt give it a score lower ...
customer_reviews.text: Sad to say i CAnt give it a score lower the one any one who is remotely tech inclined just run its a poor attainment at a tablet and feels more like a 200 dollar kids toy due to its insultingly oversimple ui and worst of all is just there to throw adds in your face
customer_reviews.author: Hououin

customer_reviews.title: Best value tablet on the market
customer_reviews.text: Has all the funtionality that I need - surfing, netflix, music, etc. Fewer apps than on android phone or Iphone - but It hasn't been a problem the important ones are there. The apps I can't get are on my phone anyway. Decent picture and great battery life. If It breaks - I'll cry a bit. But no mental breakdown or financial meltdown that would happen with other tablets that are double, triple or quadruple the price. Since this is so ncredibly cheap when boaught on black friday.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not worth what I paid and I got it in a lightning deal
customer_reviews.text: My biggest complaint is that I cannot purchase music downloads from amazon on the fire tablet! The picture quality is good but the wifi receiver and speeds seem to be dire. I have regular problems even getting onto amazon shopping! Frankly I'm disgusted withvthis purchase and feel Amazon should remove its name from it until the manufacturer improves it.
customer_reviews.author: MAFG

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, but now very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in November 2018 and was very pleased with my purchase. No problems at all and worked as expected. However, picked up my tablet today at it's dead as the proverbial door nail. It just won't charge and looking at previous poor reviews it seems this is a common fault. My "returns" deadline has just expired so I am out of pocket and out of a tablet - without much hope of any help from Amazon judging by other people's comments. Just not good enough that this expensive (for me anyway) item is now only fit for the rubbish bin. Not a happy Bunny at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Amazon by name
customer_reviews.text: It has taken a while to get used to the Kindle Fire. I used my Nexus 10 for everything but the Kindle Fire is OK for playing games. I use my Samsung phone for important things now. I find the adverts on opening my tablet annoying. The Alexa is similar to Google but it can only interact with equipment that is 'smart' controllable. The good things are: Good graphics: Good battery life and the screen is nice and sensitive. For the price it is a good deal and the monthly payments with no extra charge excellent. However, the Kindle Fire appears to be a marketing tool for Amazon. PS just 13 months after purchase the charging port doesn't work. Grrr
customer_reviews.author: Old Romantic

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap tablet, shame about the screen
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to like this product and used it for a few days. Really fast, easy to get onto apps and battery life seemed great. However I had to send this back due to the poor screen quality, if you have any Apple device or are used to high quality displays like myself, I just couldn’t watch anything on it due to the images on the screens low quality. However this wouldn’t bother many people and have friends who use fire HD and are happy with the screen, just not for me. Would recommend for children’s use.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Best Value for Money Out There
customer_reviews.text: Honestly cannot fault this tablet. The screen size is absolutely perfect for reading, studying and watching things. The sound quality is pretty fab too. The red back has a lovely feel and the tablet is quite light for its size. It's fast switching between applications and is an excellent medium for all things Amazon. If you don't have Prime, it might be a bit different in how the features are useful for you but if you're wanting a tablet to just function as a tablet without the logo and therefore huge price then this one is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah F

customer_reviews.title: Oh dear
customer_reviews.text: Reasonable quality on the build, but not too solid. I installed Play Store to expand the possibility of use for this Tablet. Used it a couple of times in 7 months. In the middle of the Covid Pandemic, I needed to use this for a Zoom video meeting, only to find out that the microphone (if installed) didn't work. I tried Zoom Settings, Skype Settings, then tried Alexa, but this device has no microphone. If I could give this zero stars, I would, but the minimum seems to be one star. I wish I'd put the extra bit of money to this and purchased a Galaxy Tab.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Berry

customer_reviews.title: Good piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a Fire that was getting old and slow. It is an excellent product that is quite easy to set up and it picked up my previous Amazon purchases straight away. My only adverse comment is that it arrived with zero charge in it. This meant that when I put it on the charger nothing appeared to be happening for some time. At first, I thought I had been sent a defective product but, eventually, it became obvious that it actually was charging. So, if you get one of these and seems to be as dead as a dodo, give it a good while on the charger before concluding that it is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this has a replacement for my gen 2 kindle has it was out dated, I love the screen size it will come in handy when reading it’s also great for watching Netflix & IPlayer I’m just a little disappointed that I can’t download Nowtv, Alexa is also a great addition, the set up is quick and easy and the lay out is so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Riley

customer_reviews.title: As good as it looks
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I wasn't sure what to expect but happy to say I'm impressed. The screen quality is really good and the touchscreen very responsive sive. Not sure why people were saying it was slow to charge - I didn't think it was slow I do admit though that I had to go the Google route - can't function without Chrome or Play Store - happily it was as easy to do as some said it was. Am now very happy with the whole thing and look forward to many happy hours surfing and playing games.
customer_reviews.author: Waldo1

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed ...a down grade from the previous model
customer_reviews.text: Was very disappointed in this I had tried out an older version and was very impressed with its features and responsiveness . Sadly the 2017 version is a cheaper scaled down version for example it has no hdmi for secondary display or any way of casting to a tv . One of the reasons I chose the fire was because of its previous capabilities .Most companies would try and add to its features not reduce them . Well I suppose you get what you pay for ... and I should have checked the spec more
customer_reviews.author: NR

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Pretty disappointed to be honest. Didn’t know couldn’t download apps from Google play as assumed it was android like my first kindle fire. Can’t customise it cause of special offers. I stupidly thought special offers meant I get offers from amazon not that I’d be having adverts 24/7. Doesn’t connect to my 5ghz internet though it says it does and barely stays connected to my 2ghz. If I could send it back used I would and save up for a good android. I do love this pay monthly thing amazon are doing. Wish more items were available as much easier for people who are long term disabled and sick like me to balance without being stung with interest.
customer_reviews.author: Originalkitten

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price!
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice tablet....but...it replaces a fire hdx 8.6 which was superb..that camera was 5million pixels on the forward facing camera, the images were Fab, and could be enlarged clearly.with this tablet, at 2million, not so good. Sadly, my 8.6 died. This is also quite heavy in comparison, having arthritis, the weight is also important to me. The screen on the fire 10 however, is a wonderful size, have been watching films on it, and am very pleased with it. The price for this tablet is amazing value for what you get, and yes, I would recommend it, but if pictures are important to you, buy a good camera at the same time!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Skinner

customer_reviews.title: It's an Amazon Services only thing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking I would be able to work around the lack of gmail, Word, chrome etc. Unfortunately, Amazon's replacements for these services are rubbish. For example, downloading PDFs from an email involves a search through an ugly email app, finding the attachment which is not nearly obvious enough, then downloading it and viewing in a poor PDF reader. Not a good experience. The actual hardware is fantastic for the cost, but the poor software makes it pretty redundant in my opinion. Buy a tablet with proper Android or IOS on it I think. Even if you spend less than £200 on a second hand or budget one.
customer_reviews.author: John Cane

customer_reviews.title: Had an issue after two weeks
customer_reviews.text: Had it For two weeks when it developed a fault both with music and video, when playing music it would stop after 19 seconds tap the screen and it would play for another 19 seconds and stop the when watching a film or any video the screen would freeze or lose sound. Contacted their customer service went through a few scenarios to try and resolve the issue but couldn’t they offered a replacement which arrived the next day couldn’t fault their customer service. When it was working I was very impressed with it good value for money just hoping the fault was a one off.
customer_reviews.author: Mr James Dowd

customer_reviews.title: Very Good - Just One Bugbear
customer_reviews.text: I actually have 3 Kindles in 3 different sizes, having bought them in 2013, 2014, then this one in 2018. I also have had Ipads and my partner does, and I find the Kindle does pretty much everything I would do on an Ipad, with one very annoying exception. It doesn't let me put website shortcuts on the homescreen. This used to be less of an issue but is becoming more important, and is the main reason why my next tablet purchase is likely to be an Ipad. But if that's not important to you, it's a great product and I'd definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: You're fighting Amazon's inferior operating system the whole way and getting rid of ads is a nightmare, even after you've paid the extra 10 quid to opt out of Amazon offers. It's also pretty slow and the browser looks weird. I installed Google Play Store which helps a bit but it's still not amazing. The screen also randomly turns on whenever you get a notification (and there are a lot of notifications). Tried everything to stop this and eventually managed it - can't tell you what it was that worked though! I should have gone for an Android device - realise that now.
customer_reviews.author: S. O'CONNOR

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Only tablet on the market that can't screen mirror. Slow and unresponsive. Although Android based you must re buy apps. Don't waste money on one of these just buy a Galaxy tab
customer_reviews.author: purplesheep

product_meta.title: Fire HD 10 Tablet, 1080p Full HD Display, 32 GB, Black—with Special Offers (Previous Generation - 7th)

Up to 1.8 GHZ quad-core processor, 2 GB of RAM and Dolby Atmos audio.
32 or 64 GB of internal storage and a microSD slot for up to 256 GB of expandable storage.
VGA front-facing camera and 2 MP rear-facing camera.
Enjoy millions of movies, TV programmes, songs, Kindle eBooks, apps and games including Netflix, Facebook, Spotify and more.
